sn35.228:1.1: “Bhikkhus, an unlearned ordinary person speaks of the ocean.
sn35.228:1.2: But that’s not the ocean in the training of the Noble One.
sn35.228:1.3: That’s just a large body of water, a large sea of water.
sn35.228:1.4: The eye, bhikkhus, is the ocean for a man,
sn35.228:1.5: and its tide is made of sights.
sn35.228:2.1: One who withstands that tide is said to have crossed over the ocean of the eye, with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters.
sn35.228:2.2: Crossed over, the brahmin stands on dry land.
sn35.228:2.7: The mental faculty is the ocean for a man,
sn35.228:2.8: and its tide is made of phenomena.
sn35.228:2.9: One who withstands that tide is said to have crossed over the ocean of the mental faculty, with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters.
sn35.228:2.10: Crossed over, the brahmin stands on dry land.”
sn35.228:2.11: That is what the Buddha said.
sn35.228:2.12: Then the Excellent One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn35.228:3.1: “He who has crossed this ocean so hard to cross, with its saltwater crocodiles and monsters,
sn35.228:3.2: With its waves, whirlpools, and dangers,
sn35.228:3.3: He, perfected in understanding, who has completed the renunciate path,
sn35.228:3.4: Is called ‘One who reached the end of the world, and went beyond’.
